adept.common

Class TACKBP2014EventArgument

  • java.lang.Object
    • adept.common.TACKBP2014EventArgument

  • public final class TACKBP2014EventArgument
extends Object
    This represents event arguments produced by a TAC KBP 2014 Event Argument evaluation system. Please see the evaluation site for more details. This class is primarily for loading the output of non-ADEPT systems. ADEPT-based event argument systems should prefer to populate DocumentEventArguments directly.

    No fields will ever be null or contain null.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TACKBP2014EventArgument.Realis
      This represents the realis distinctions from the 2014 TAC KBP event argument evaluation.

      • create

        public static TACKBP2014EventArgument create(String documentID,
                             IType eventType,
                             IType argumentRole,
                             TACKBP2014EventArgument.Realis realis,
                             TokenOffset canonicalArgumentChunk,
                             String canonicalArgumentString,
                             TokenOffset baseFiller,
                             Iterable<TokenOffset> predicateJustifications,
                             Iterable<TokenOffset> additionalArgumentJustifications)
        Creates a TACK2014EventArgument. No arguments may be null or contain null. All TokenOffset arguments are in terms of character offsets.
        Parameters:
        predicateJustifications - May not be empty.

      • getCanonicalArgumentChunk

        public TokenOffset getCanonicalArgumentChunk()
        This is the character offsets of the canonical argument string, which may be a more representative string for the argument entity than the base filler.
        Returns:
        Will never be null.

      • getCanonicalArgumentString

        public String getCanonicalArgumentString()
        Gets the string value of the canonical argument string. This may differ from the text at the specified character offsets due to normalization, time-resolution, etc.
        Returns:
        Will never be @{code null}.

      • getPredicateJustifications

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet<TokenOffset> getPredicateJustifications()
        Gets the character offsets of the text spans which justify that the base filler fills the specified argument role of an event of the specified type. The base filler will almost always be contained within one of these strings, but this is not strictly required. Will never be empty.

      • getAdditionalArgumentJustifications

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet<TokenOffset> getAdditionalArgumentJustifications()
        Gets the character offsets of the text spans which justify the claim that, given the the base filler occupies the specified argument slot, so does the CAS. Evidence of coreference is excluded, so typically this will be empty. It will be filled in cases of e.g. membership inference.
        Returns:
